item.title: Pump OVHT Indication Systems Left, Center, and Right Pump OVHT Lights – Pump Operative

remarks.para: One in each hydraulic system may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated low SYS PRESS light or pump low PRESS light is operative, and
Associated pump is verified to be operative before each departure.

note.para: During ground operation of the affected pump, to prevent Hydraulic Pump damage from overheat, do not operate pumps without a minimum of 600 lbs. of fuel in tanks.

numlitem.para: Ensure personnel are clear of flight controls.
Establish electrical power on the aircraft.
Before engine start and prior to selecting HYD pumps ON, verify associated low SYS PRESS or pump low PRESS light(s) illuminated.
On the Accessory Panel (P61), select the EICAS Maintenance Control Switch ELEC/HYD and observe the lower EICAS screen for HYD PRESS and TEMP.
Select associated HYD pump ON using the following procedure(s):

note.para: The pump being tested must be the only pump operating within the related hydraulic system at the time of the test.

para.emphasis: An active brake source is required when operating an engine.

numlitem.para: -With affected engine running, press ENG pump switch ON.
-With electrical power on aircraft, press affected ELEC pump switch to ON.
Verify associated (Left, Center, Right) HYD PRESS reading on EICAS within 2800 to 3200 psig range.
Verify associated (Left, Center, Right) HYD TEMP reading on EICAS is less than 80 degrees C.

placard.para: Placard affected Hydraulic Pump OVHT light(s) on Hydraulic Control panel "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
